tool.name: SAGA.ta_channels.3
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayELEVATION False isArrayCHANNELS False output_data_DISTANCE $output_data_DISTANCE output_data_BASELEVEL $output_data_BASELEVEL name SAGA.ta_channels.3 ELEVATION $ELEVATION CHANNELS $CHANNELS THRESHOLD $THRESHOLD MAXITER $MAXITER NOUNDERGROUND $NOUNDERGROUND prefer $prefer response $response outputType_DISTANCE $OutputSection_DISTANCE.outputType_DISTANCE transmissionMode_DISTANCE $OutputSection_DISTANCE.transmissionMode_DISTANCE outputType_BASELEVEL $OutputSection_BASELEVEL.outputType_BASELEVEL transmissionMode_BASELEVEL $OutputSection_BASELEVEL.transmissionMode_BASELEVEL

param.name: ELEVATION
param.label: Elevation
param.help: A grid that contains elevation data. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, tiff, png, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: CHANNELS
param.label: Channel Network
param.help: A grid providing information about the channel network. It is assumed that no-data cells are not part of the channel network. Vice versa all others cells are recognised as channel network members. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, tiff, png, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: THRESHOLD
param.label: Tension Threshold
param.help: Maximum change in elevation units (e.g. meter), iteration is stopped once maximum change reaches this threshold.

param.name: MAXITER
param.label: Maximum Iterations
param.help: Maximum number of iterations, ignored if set to zero

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_DISTANCE
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_DISTANCE
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_BASELEVEL
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_BASELEVEL
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool calculates the vertical distance to a channel network base level. The algorithm consists of two major steps:<br/> 1. Interpolation of a channel network base level elevation<br/> 2. Subtraction of this base level from the original elevations<br/>
